chapter.title: List View
chapter.para: If you wish to find all material available in a certain path, leave the search term empty and click Search. Double-clicking on a folder has the same effect.
If you search for a specific term inside the path you have selected, or make an "empty search" to retrieve all records, you are presented with a list view.

The format presented in the list view follows The Chicago Manual of Style.
If you find that information you have put in is not displayed, please open a Ticket .

To the right of the numbering of the item in question, you see the Save Record to My List button , which allows you to collect the record temporarily in a list accessed from the My List tab from which it can be exported. The Save Record to My List button is also present on the detail view.

In the right corner, you find a graphic representation of the kind of resource the record is about (here "text," represented by ). Hover over the icon to see its meaning. This icon is also present on the detail view.
If you click on any of the hits in the list, you are taken to the detail view.
